snippet: Related Companies, a prolific New York City builder, has been charged with discriminating against disabled tenants in the design of two Manhattan apartment buildings.
abstract: Manhattan’s top federal prosecutor files a civil rights lawsuit against Related Companies, one of New York City’s most prolific builders, charging that the developer had violated the Fair Housing Act by discriminating against disabled tenants in the design of two 23-year-old apartment buildings; prosecutors are widely expected to file similar lawsuits against other developers for violating city's accessibility law.
lead_paragraph: Related Companies, a prolific New York City builder, has been charged with discriminating against disabled tenants in the design of two Manhattan apartment buildings.

headline.main: Suit Alleges Developer Violated Civil Rights
headline.print_headline: Suit Alleges Developer Violated Civil Rights
